rev5.name: Acquisition Strategies, Tools, and Methods
rev5.changes_from_rev4: New control family introduced in Rev 5

attack_techniques.name: Supply Chain Compromise
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Employing rigorous acquisition strategies including vendor vetting, software provenance verification, and contract security requirements reduces the risk of supply chain compromise during procurement.

attack_techniques.name: Server Software Component
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Acquisition controls that require security testing and code review of third-party server components before deployment prevent adversaries from introducing malicious server software through the supply chain.

attack_techniques.name: Compromise Host Software Binary
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Supply chain acquisition strategies that verify software binary integrity through hash comparison and code signing validation detect compromised host software introduced during distribution.

attack_techniques.name: Modify System Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Acquisition controls requiring firmware provenance verification and integrity validation for network equipment prevent adversaries from introducing modified system images through the hardware supply chain.

attack_techniques.name: AppleScript
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Supply chain vetting for macOS software that evaluates AppleScript automation capabilities identifies applications that adversaries could exploit for AppleScript-based execution after deployment.

attack_techniques.name: Compromise Software Dependencies and Development Tools
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Acquisition strategies that audit software dependencies, enforce package signing, and verify build pipeline integrity prevent adversaries from compromising development tools and libraries before procurement.

attack_techniques.name: Compromise Software Supply Chain
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Vendor security assessments, software composition analysis, and binary verification during acquisition prevent adversaries from introducing compromised software through vendor distribution channels.

attack_techniques.name: Compromise Hardware Supply Chain
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Hardware supply chain controls including tamper-evident packaging, vendor attestation, and component provenance verification prevent adversaries from introducing compromised hardware during procurement.

attack_techniques.name: Malicious Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Acquisition strategies for container images that enforce registry controls, image signing, and vulnerability scanning prevent procurement and deployment of malicious container images.

attack_techniques.name: SQL Stored Procedures
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Acquisition controls that require security review of database extensions and stored procedures before deployment prevent introduction of malicious SQL components through vendor packages.

attack_techniques.name: Transport Agent
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Supply chain vetting for email server components that validates Transport Agent integrity prevents adversaries from introducing malicious mail pipeline components through software procurement.

attack_techniques.name: IIS Components
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Acquisition strategies for web server modules that require IIS component signing and vendor verification prevent adversaries from introducing malicious web server components during deployment.

attack_techniques.name: LC_LOAD_DYLIB Addition
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Supply chain verification of macOS application binaries for unauthorized LC_LOAD_DYLIB entries prevents adversaries from distributing applications pre-configured to load malicious dynamic libraries.

attack_techniques.name: Patch System Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Acquisition controls requiring cryptographic verification of firmware images against vendor-provided hashes detect tampered network device images introduced during procurement or distribution.

attack_techniques.name: Downgrade System Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Supply chain management practices that enforce minimum firmware versions and prevent procurement of devices with outdated firmware eliminate downgrade attack vectors at acquisition time.
